name: 4-fluorobenzoic acid
Reason: The target compound, 4-fluorobenzoic acid, is based on a benzene ring which has a melting point of 5.5°C. Adding a carboxyl group increases the melting point due to the possibility of hydrogen bonding and the polarity it introduces, giving a rough estimate of +150°C. The introduction of a fluorine atom on the benzene ring will also increase the melting point, due to the effect of the highly electronegative fluorine increasing intermolecular forces (dipole-dipole interactions); this effect can be estimated at around +30°C. These effects are somewhat cumulative but may not be strictly additive due to the interaction between the carboxyl group and the fluorine atom's influence on the electronic structure of the benzene ring, which might slightly moderate the total increase.
